com.myscript.atk.sltw

Interface SingleLineTextWidgetApi


  • public interface SingleLineTextWidgetApi
    This interface describes the public API of the single line text widget component.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Interface definition for callbacks to be invoked when the user is scrolling the writing area.

    • Method Detail

      • setOnTextChangedListener

        void setOnTextChangedListener(SingleLineTextWidgetApi.OnTextChangedListener l)
        Register a callback to be invoked when the text changes.
        Parameters:
        l - The listener to attach to this widget.
        See Also:
        SingleLineTextWidgetApi.OnTextChangedListener

      • setText

        void setText(String text)
        Set the text displayed and managed by this widget.

        This function calls the text changed callback synchronously after the text has been updated.

        If the widget is currently in insertion mode, the writing area will automatically scroll to the end of the content after updating the displayed text.

        Parameters:
        text - String representation of the text.
        See Also:
        SingleLineTextWidgetApi.OnTextChangedListener.onTextChanged(String, boolean), setInsertionMode(int)

      • replaceCharacters

        void replaceCharacters(int start,
                     int end,
                     String text)
        Replace characters in the text.

        Characters may be inserted at any location in the text by calling this function with the same start and end character indices and a non-empty replacement string.

        Characters may be deleted from the text by calling this function with a non-empty characters range and an empty or null replacement string.

        This function calls the text changed callback synchronously after characters have been replaced.

        Parameters:
        start - Character index of the first character to replace.
        end - Character index past the last character to replace.
        text - Replacement text string (may be null).
        See Also:
        SingleLineTextWidgetApi.OnTextChangedListener.onTextChanged(String, boolean)

      • setInsertionMode

        boolean setInsertionMode(int index)
        Put the widget in insertion mode.

        Insertion mode is designed to enable the user to write text in a continuous flow. Scrolling of the writing area is managed by the widget. The writing area scrolls automatically after the user has finished writing and the auto scroll delay is elapsed. Upon entering insertion mode, the writing area will automatically scroll to the end of the content after a delay.

        The application provides an insertion point index upon entering insertion mode. This is the location at which text will be inserted by the user. If the insertion point index is located in the middle of the text, the text will be split in two halves in the writing area. Text is appended to the left half while the right half remains unchanged.

        The insertion point is automatically moved, as text is appended by the user, and the insertion point index is adjusted accordingly by the widget.

        The following holds true for the insertion mode:

        • The widget takes care of auto-scrolling to the insertion point.
        • The cursor is hidden.
        • An insertion window opens if the insert index is in the middle of the text.
        Parameters:
        index - Character index of the insertion point.
        Returns:
        true if index is located at the end of the text or text can be split at specified index, false if insert index cannot be moved at specified index and text cannot be split.
        See Also:
        isInsertionMode(), getInsertIndex()

      • setCorrectionMode

        void setCorrectionMode()
        Put the widget in correction mode.

        Correction mode is designed to enable the user to navigate and edit the text already entered. Cursor is shown as long as it remains within the text. The widget does not scroll the writing area automatically. The application can use any of the provided scrolling methods to scroll the writing area.

        A drag handle is displayed for a limited time after the cursor is moved. The user can drag this handle to control the position of the cursor. Note that the position of the cursor is not actually changed by the widget, you need to call setCursorIndex(int) to set the position of the cursor.

        The following holds true for the correction mode:

        • The widget does not scroll the writing area automatically.
        • The cursor is visible.
        • The insertion window closes if it is currently opened.
        See Also:
        SingleLineTextWidgetApi.OnCursorHandleDragListener, setCursorIndex(int)

      • isInsertionMode

        boolean isInsertionMode()
        Indicates whether the widget is in insertion mode.
        Returns:
        true if the widget is in insertion mode, false if in correction mode.

      • isIsolatedMode

        boolean isIsolatedMode()
        Indicates whether the widget is configured with isolated recognition mode. Recognition mode is set by default when loading isolated resources into the widget.
        Returns:
        true if the widget is configured with isolated recognition mode false if configured with cursive.

      • getInsertIndex

        int getInsertIndex()
        Returns the index of the insertion point.
        Returns:
        Character index of the insertion point or -1 if no insertion point is available (i.e. the widget is in correction mode).

      • setOnInsertionWindowListener

        void setOnInsertionWindowListener(SingleLineTextWidgetApi.OnInsertionWindowListener onInsertionWindowListener)
        Register callbacks to be invoked when the insertion window did closed.
        Parameters:
        onInsertionWindowListener - The listener to attach to this widget.
        See Also:
        SingleLineTextWidgetApi.OnInsertionWindowListener

      • smoothScrollToCursor

        void smoothScrollToCursor()
        Scroll smoothly the writing area, if needed, so that the cursor is visible.

        The widget must be in correction mode (in insertion mode, the cursor is always hidden by design, so scrolling to cursor has no effect).

        The scroll operation is canceled and this method does nothing if the user is currently scrolling the writing area.

        See Also:
        isUserScrolling(), setCorrectionMode()

      • scrollToCursor

        void scrollToCursor()
        Scroll the writing area, if needed, so that the cursor is visible.

        The widget must be in correction mode (in insertion mode, the cursor is always hidden by design, so scrolling to cursor has no effect).

        The scroll operation is canceled and this method does nothing if the user is currently scrolling the writing area.

        See Also:
        isUserScrolling(), setCorrectionMode()

      • smoothScrollTo

        void smoothScrollTo(int index)
        Scroll smoothly the writing area to the given character index.

        The widget defines margins on each side of the screen that are used to clamp the position of the cursor handle while scrolling. For example, when the handle hits the left margin and the writing area can scroll left, the handle remains at the boundary of the left margin and the widget starts to scroll left. Same thing for the right margin.

        The widget scrolls the writing area so that the given character index is positioned on the boundary of the left scroll margin, for left-to-right languages. For right-to-left languages, the given character index is positioned on the boundary of the right scroll margin.

        The widget does not scroll if it is already scrolled all the way to the left or to the right and the requested character index is visible. Also, the widget does not scroll if the requested character index is already visible and is not inside the left or right scroll margins.

        The scroll operation is canceled and this method does nothing if the user is currently scrolling the writing area.

        Parameters:
        index - Character index to scroll to.
        See Also:
        isUserScrolling()

      • scrollTo

        void scrollTo(int index)
        Scroll the writing area to the given character index.

        The widget defines margins on each side of the screen that are used to clamp the position of the cursor handle while scrolling. For example, when the handle hits the left margin and the writing area can scroll left, the handle remains at the boundary of the left margin and the widget starts to scroll left. Same thing for the right margin.

        The widget scrolls the writing area so that the given character index is positioned on the boundary of the left scroll margin, for left-to-right languages. For right-to-left languages, the given character index is positioned on the boundary of the right scroll margin.

        The widget does not scroll if it is already scrolled all the way to the left or to the right and the requested character index is visible. Also, the widget does not scroll if the requested character index is already visible and is not inside the left or right scroll margins.

        The scroll operation is canceled and this method does nothing if the user is currently scrolling the writing area.

        Parameters:
        index - Character index to scroll to.
        See Also:
        isUserScrolling()

      • smoothCenterTo

        void smoothCenterTo(int index)
        Center smoothly the writing area around the given character index.

        The widget scrolls the writing area so that the given character index is located at the center of the screen, if possible.

        The scroll operation is canceled and this method does nothing if the user is currently scrolling the writing area.

        Parameters:
        index - Character index to put at the center of the screen.
        See Also:
        isUserScrolling()

      • centerTo

        void centerTo(int index)
        Center the writing area around the given character index.

        The widget scrolls the writing area so that the given character index is located at the center of the screen, if possible.

        The scroll operation is canceled and this method does nothing if the user is currently scrolling the writing area.

        Parameters:
        index - Character index to put at the center of the screen.
        See Also:
        isUserScrolling()

        See Also:

      • isUserScrolling

        boolean isUserScrolling()
        Indicates whether the user is currently scrolling the writing area.

        This function returns true only if the widget is scrolling in response to the user scrolling via the scrollbar or hovering the stylus over the display. This function returns false if the widget is currently scrolling due to auto-scrolling or in response of any of the scrolling functions.

        Returns:
        true if the user the currently scrolling the writing area using the scrollbar or by hovering the stylus over the display, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        SingleLineTextWidgetApi.OnUserScrollListener

      • setCursorIndex

        void setCursorIndex(int index)
        Set the position of the cursor.

        Positioning the cursor inside the text automatically selects the word at the position of the cursor. This may trigger a selection changed event if a new word or character is selected.

        Moving the cursor out of the bounds of the text (i.e. at a negative index or past the length of the text) clears the selection and may trigger a selection changed event if current selection is not empty.

        The cursor is moved in the writing area if it is currently visible. The cursor disappears if it is currently visible and moved out of the bounds of the text, or outside the currently visible portion of the text. The cursor will be shown again as soon as the cursor is moved back into the text.

        When the the box mode is enabled, the given index correspond to a box index.

        Parameters:
        index - Character index of the cursor in cursive and the Guide box index of the cursor in isolated.
        See Also:
        SingleLineTextWidgetApi.OnSelectionChangedListener.onSelectionChanged(int, int, String[], int), smoothScrollToCursor()

      • getCursorIndex

        int getCursorIndex()
        Return the position of the cursor.
        Returns:
        Character index of the cursor in cursive and the Guide box index of the cursor in isolated.

      • moveCursorToVisibleIndex

        boolean moveCursorToVisibleIndex()
        Move the cursor, if needed, to an index that is visible to the user.
        Returns:
        true if the cursor was actually moved, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        getCursorIndex()

      • configure

        void configure(String locale,
             String[] resources,
             String[] lexicon,
             byte[] certificate)
        Configure the handwriting recognition engine.

        This function is non-blocking and returns immediately.

        To use the classic cursive mode, use the isolated resources. To use the Box mode, use the isolated resources. Please note that the Box mode is not available for the RTL languages and the Thailand (th_TH) language.

        Configuration is a lengthy process that may take up to several seconds, depending on the handwriting resources to be configured. It is recommended to setup a configuration listener to detect the end of the configuration process.

        When the device is rotated, Android completely recreates the UI without restarting the process of the application. You should configure the new instance of SingleLineTextWidgetApi by calling this function again.

        Parameters:
        locale - String representation of the handwriting recognition locale.
        resources - Array of paths to handwriting resource files.
        lexicon - Array of user lexicon entries. May be null.
        certificate - Byte array containing the handwriting recognition certificate.
        See Also:
        SingleLineTextWidgetApi.OnConfigureListener

      • releaseEngine

        void releaseEngine()
        Release the handwriting recognition engine and resources.

        You should call this function if you are using the StylusCore loader library (libloadStylusCore.so) before dynamically reloading a StylusCore library to disconnect the widget from the currently loaded StylusCore library.

        See Also:
        configure(String, String[], String[], byte[])

      • getErrorCode

        int getErrorCode()
        Return an error code describing the error that happened during the configuration, if any.
        Returns:
        Error code describing the error or 0 if no error.

      • getErrorString

        String getErrorString()
        Return a string describing the error that happened during the configuration, if any.
        Returns:
        String describing the error.

      • setBoxMask

        void setBoxMask(int start,
              int end,
              boolean hide)

        Set hidden or shown range of the text in box mode.

        It will be used to act as a 'password mode'.

        Parameters:
        start - first character index of the mask.
        end - last character index of the mask.
        hide - true if the given range indicates the portion of text that shall be hidden, and the rest of the text will be shown false if the given range indicates the portion of text that shall be shown, and the rest of the text will be hidden.

      • setBoxesResource

        void setBoxesResource(int resid)
                      throws IllegalArgumentException

        Set the appearance of the boxes to a given resource.

        By default the resource is a light gray square.

        Parameters:
        resid - Identifier of the resource.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Guide boxes resources should be NinePatchDrawable or ColorDrawable, otherwise an IllegalArgumentException is thrown

        See Also:

      • setAutoScrollDelay

        void setAutoScrollDelay(int delay)
        Set the delay after which the writing area scrolls automatically once the user has finished writing.

        This delay only applies in insertion mode.

        This is a convenience method. This is equivalent to calling: 

         setAutoScrollDelays(delay, [current delayWhenNearlyFull value])
        Parameters:
        delay - Delay in milliseconds.
        See Also:
        setInsertionMode(int), setAutoScrollDelays(int, int)

      • setAutoScrollDelays

        void setAutoScrollDelays(int delayWhenNearlyEmpty,
                       int delayWhenNearlyFull)
        Set parameters of the auto-scroll delay.

        In insertion mode, the writing area scrolls automatically after a delay once the user has finished writing. This delay is computed from the nearly full/nearly empty delay values provided to this function.

        After each stroke, the widget computes the amount of visible space left on the screen and available for writing. If the visible portion of the writing area is nearly full, the widget will compute a scroll delay that is close to the delayWhenNearlyFull value. If the visible portion of the writing area is nearly empty, the widget will compute a scroll delay that is close to the delayWhenNearlyEmpty value. In-between delay values are computed if the visible portion of the writing area is half full.

        Typically, leaving delays as their default values, the widget scrolls the writing area automatically after a long delay if there is a lot of space available for writing. The widget scrolls the writing area automatically after a short delay if there is little space available for writing.

        This feature only applies in insertion mode.

        Parameters:
        delayWhenNearlyEmpty - Delay in milliseconds applied when the visible portion of the writing area is nearly empty.
        delayWhenNearlyFull - Delay in milliseconds applied when the visible portion of the writing area is nearly full.
        See Also:
        setInsertionMode(int)

      • setAutoTypesetEnabled

        void setAutoTypesetEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Set whether the widget typesets ink automatically.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true if the widget shall typeset (turn ink into characters) automatically after a delay, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        setAutoTypesetDelay(int)

      • setAutoTypesetDelay

        void setAutoTypesetDelay(int delay)
        Set delay after which the widget typesets ink automatically.

        This delay only applies in insertion mode.

        This is a convenience method. This is equivalent to calling: 

         setAutoTypesetDelays([current delayWhenNearlyEmpty value], delay)
        In order to ensure that this feature is working properly, configure() should be called right after this method call.
        Parameters:
        delay - Delay in milliseconds.
        See Also:
        setAutoTypesetDelays(int, int)

      • setAutoTypesetDelays

        void setAutoTypesetDelays(int delayWhenNearlyEmpty,
                        int delayWhenNearlyFull)
        Set parameters of the auto-typeset delay.

        In insertion mode, the widget turns ink into characters (typesets) automatically after a delay once the user has finished writing. This delay is computed from the nearly full/nearly empty delay values provided to this function.

        After each stroke, the widget computes the amount of visible space left on the screen and available for writing. If the visible portion of the writing area is nearly full, the widget will compute a typeset delay that is close to the delayWhenNearlyFull value. If the visible portion of the writing area is nearly empty, the widget will compute a typeset delay that is close to the delayWhenNearlyEmpty value. In-between delay values are computed if the visible portion of the writing area is half full.

        Typically, leaving delays as their default values, the widget triggers a typeset of the ink after a short delay if there is a lot of space available for writing. The widget triggers a typeset of the ink after a long delay if there is little space available for writing.

        This feature only applies in insertion mode. In order to ensure that this feature is working properly, configure() should be called right after this method call.

        Parameters:
        delayWhenNearlyEmpty - Delay in milliseconds applied when the visible portion of the writing area is nearly empty.
        delayWhenNearlyFull - Delay in milliseconds applied when the visible portion of the writing area is nearly full.
        See Also:
        setInsertionMode(int)

      • setHoverEnabled

        void setHoverEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Enable or disable hover functionality.

        This feature is only available on devices that support hovering events, such as Samsung Galaxy Note series for example.

        Parameters:
        enabled - true if hover functionality is enabled, false otherwise.

      • setTransientSpaceEnabled

        void setTransientSpaceEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Enable or disable transient space functionality.

        In insertion mode, a space mark is shown right after the content in the baseline, as a dashed line. This space mark is called transient space.

        If the user writes in the transient space area, the space mark disappears and this indicates that no space shall be added between the actual content and what the user is writing. If the user writes beyond the transient space area, a space character shall be added by the widget between the actual content and what the user is writing.

        Parameters:
        enabled - true if transient space functionality is enabled, false otherwise.

      • setTransientSpaceVisibleWhenEmpty

        void setTransientSpaceVisibleWhenEmpty(boolean visible)
        Set the visibility state of the transient space mark when the writing area is empty.
        Parameters:
        visible - true if the transient space shall be visible when the writing area is empty, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        setTransientSpaceEnabled(boolean)
